item.title: Heidi add a quote by Logan Pearsall Smith
item.description: "What I like in a good author is not what he says, but what he whispers." -- Logan Pearsall Smith

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Louis L'Amour
item.description: "A mistake constantly made by those who should know better is to judge people of the past by our standards rather than their own. The only way men or women can be judged is against the canvas of their own time." -- Louis L'Amour

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Wenzel Anton Kaunitz-Rietberg
item.description: "Much is not dared because it seems hard; much seems hard only because it is not dared." -- Wenzel Anton Kaunitz-Rietberg

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Louis L'Amour
item.description: "I have read my books by many lights, hoarding their beauty, their wit or wisdom against the dark days when I would have no book, nor a place to read. I have known hunger of the belly kind many times over, but I have known a worse hunger: the need to know and to learn." -- Louis L'Amour

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion." -- Abraham Lincoln
